page.title: 17 Staunton
page.content: The village of{Staunton}lies west of Long Bennington. It has a population of 45.{Mr.Staunton}lives in{Staunton {Hall.}His family have lived in the village since the eleventh century. They took their name from the village and were called de Staunton. Later they changed their family name to Staunton. The Staunton family built Staunton Hall and the church next to the Hall. Also most of the Staunton family were rectors in that church. It is a tradition that the family help to defend{Belvoir Castle.}In Staunton there was a walnut tree which was felled in 1923, it was found, by counting the rings, to be 625 years old. During the{Civil War}Oliver Cromwell's men raided Staunton Hall, 2 cannonball holes still can be seen in the main door. The contents were sold and the church was ransacked.
